contents.text: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has reported two cases of the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Bengaluru. The cases involve a 3-month-old and an 8-month-old infant, detected through routine surveillance for respiratory viruses.  The health ministry says that India is fully prepared to manage respiratory illnesses.

The HMPV causes symptoms similar to the common cold, particularly affecting children and the elderly and those with weakened immune systems. It spreads through contact and can cause symptoms like cough, fever, and nasal congestion. It is important to follow respiratory etiquette and use regular medicines for cold and fever.
Press release from Press Information Bureau, Govt of India, addressing the coverage of HMPV Virus in media and raising awareness about the virus and that it's not so serious an issue.
